brief_summary.textblock:
To study the safety and efficacy of four different doses of Wobenzym (an enzyme combination
      consisting of pancreatin, papain, bromelain, trypsin, lipase, amylase, chymotrypsin, and
      rutin) in patients with HIV infection whose CD4 count is between 250 and 400 cells/mm3. To
      evaluate the effect of Wobenzym on certain surrogate markers associated with progression of
      HIV disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety of Four Different Dose Levels of Wobenzym in HIV-Positive Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria

        Patients must have:

        HIV seropositivity with CD4 counts between 250 and 400 cells/mm3.

        Exclusion Criteria

        Co-existing Condition:

        Patients with the following symptoms or conditions are excluded:

          -  Known hypersensitivity to hydrolytic enzymes such as Wobenzym.

          -  Known sensitivity to lactose.

          -  Presumption that the patient will not comply with the dosing schedule or follow-up
             appointments.

        Concurrent Medication:

        Excluded:

          -  Concurrent use of immunosuppressive therapy or steroids.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I-II Dose Escalation Study to Examine the Safety of Four Doses of Wobenzym in HIV Seropositive Patients

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: NIH AIDS Clinical Trials Information Service
clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Primary Purpose: Treatment
